qas.question: What is the only hospital in Tuvalu?
On which island in Tuvalu is the hospital?
How many nurses does Princess Margaret have on staff?
What kind of nursing services do outer islands nurses provide?
How many nurses are provided to the outer islands?

context: The <a0_0>Princess Margaret Hospital<a0_0/> on <a1_0>Funafuti<a1_0/> is the only hospital in Tuvalu. The Tuvaluan medical staff at PMH in 2011 comprised the Director of Health & Surgeon, the Chief Medical Officer Public Health, an anaesthetist, a paediatric medical officer and an obstetrics and gynaecology medical officer. Allied health staff include two radiographers, two pharmacists, three laboratory technicians, two dieticians and <a2_0>13<a2_0/> nurses with specialised training in fields including surgical nursing, anaesthesia nursing/ICU, paediatric nursing and midwifery. PMH also employs a dentist. The Department of Health also employs <a4_0>nine or ten<a4_0/> nurses on the outer islands to provide general nursing and <a3_0>midwifery<a3_0/> services.
